description:
The anime`s story follows Tsubasa, a new hire in the A&R department of the major recording company Gandala Music. Tsubasa is immediately assigned to oversee the idol unit "B-PROJECT," which is made up of three idol groups: Kitakore, Thrive, and MooNs. This is Tsubasa`s first job, and she gets involved in various incidents and accidents as she deals with this group of young men who each have their own differing personalities.
Source: ANN

REGULAR.description:
Gandara Music`s new A&R Sumisora Tsubasa is assigned to work with the three-group and ten-man idol unit "B-PROJECT." Meeting the boys for the first time while they`re rehearsing for a music program, she`s immediately toyed with and tossed about by the quirky members of B-PROJECT. Next she accompanies Kitakore, one the groups, to the recording session of their new song. Tsubasa is enchanted by the voices of Kitakado and Korekuni, but during the song, she notices something is off.
Source: crunchyroll

During THRIVE`s production meeting for their new song, Kaneshiro expresses dissatisfaction over the song`s arrangement. He`s unable to see the point in pandering to fans any more than necessary. Meanwhile, THRIVE is hired for a gravure shoot for idol magazine "Kiss & Hug." When the chief editor Yoko Suzuki orders him to wear cat ears and make a kitty cat pose, Ashu and Aizome comply, but unable to stand it, Kaneshiro leaves the building.
Source: crunchyroll

titles.title: The Bad End Isn`t So Bad

REGULAR.description:
MooNs has arrived at a campsite in the mountains to shoot a commercial for "Star Curry." Because this is the first time one of their songs will be used in a commercial, the members are exited and getting along well. The director Ninomiya expects much from the boys, but the rest of his staff are skeptical. When Tsubasa hears them talking about MooNs, she hopes the job will teach them just how great MooNs is. However, while the shoot starts off well, a problem suddenly occurs.
Source: crunchyroll

B-PROJECT is scheduled to perform at the large-scale outdoor music festival "RAIZIN Festival." As the boys enjoy a relaxed mood following the previous day`s perfect rehearsal, they`re informed the equipment onstage has been rearranged, preventing them from using the stage formation they had planned.
Source: crunchyroll

B-PROJECT starts gaining attention after their performance at the RAIZIN Festival. They begin getting more work, and the members becoming increasingly positive about working together as a ten-man unit. An article on major actor Matsukura Kenzo`s romantic scandal is printed in a magazine. Korekuni is troubled to see his father Matsukura be the subject of gossip. When a persistent paparazzi looking for more information on Matsukura comes to Korekuni, he recalls the time he spent at the training school Bambi.
Source: crunchyroll

Kanehisor, Onzai, and Sekimura are chosen to appear in "Shinsengumi Ultimate" starring Matsukura Kenzo, and they are made to attend a workshop for all actors designed to select the actor who will play Okita Soji.
During practice, actor Wakaoji Ryunosuke`s attitude suddenly changes when he picks up a bamboo sword equipped with Kiku-ichimonji Norimune, the sword guard Okita is said to have used. Onzai senses something behind the change in his behavior.
Source: crunchyroll

Kitakado, Masunaga, Aizome, Osari, and Nome head to tourist destination "Hakozaki" for an on location shoot as reporters for information variety program "Brunch Genius". The five boys split into the ocean team and mountain team to conduct their reports. While working on the ocean team, Aizome notices certain ill feelings between Kitakado and Masunaga.
Source: crunchyroll

The ten members of B-PROJECT have come to a tropical island to take pictures for their fan book. During the shoot, they are suddenly assailed by a storm, and the cruiser carrying the members is swept away.
After the storm disperses, the members find themselves on a desert island. Unable to get in touch with Tsubasa or the film crew, Masunaga exercises his leadership skills by assigning jobs to the other members so they can wait to be rescued in security and safety. However, his own eyes are directed towards Kitakado`s back.
Source: crunchyroll

Kitakore and THRIVE are cast to star in world famous french director Sophie Vebelle`s new movie "Les chiens aboient." With the movie premiering worldwide, the boys are naturally excited. Despite being cast in the leading role, Aizomem is his usual self. When Tsubasa says they should work together to make the movie a success, he coolly responds that idols only think of themselves. However, the directors sees through him...
Source: crunchyroll

Since they`ve started appearing frequently in movies, TV, and radio programs and getting more exposure in magazines and ads, the whole world seems to be talking about B-PRO. Amidst their rising popularity, Yashamaru tells them that they`ve been scheduled for a concert at the JAPAN Dome on New Year`s Eve. Tsubasa and the members are B-PRO are overjoyed to have their dream of performing at the Dome finally come true. They immediately being preparing for the concert while also planning a surprise birthday party for Yashamaru, who has supported B-PRO since its formation.
Source: crunchyroll

With their end of year B-PROJECT JAPAN Dome concert approaching, the members of B-PRO enthusiastically work together to plan a comprehensive concert. Meanwhile, the busy Yashamaru remains absent and unable to meet with Tsubasa or the members. Tsubasa begins to feel that something is off as she encounters one puzzling problem after another on B-PRO`s jobs. Later, the song the group was meant to debut at the Dome is heard playing in the city...?!
Source: crunchyroll

Tsubasa and the members of B-PROJECT learn through the news that they`re being transferred to Highedge Records. In order to obtain an explanation, Tsubasa tries to find Yashamaru. With no clues to his location and at a total loss, when Tsubasa spots Yashamaru on a crowded street, she suddenly receives a phone call. The shocking words that come from Yashamaru leave Tsubasa stunned. Meanwhile, while Tsubasa is out, the members of B-PRO are filled in on the truth about the transfer.
Source: crunchyroll

SPECIAL.description:
A special behind the scene episode.
Source: crunchyroll

titles.title: B-PROJECT 鼓動*アンビシャス
